snippet: The police chief in Ferguson, Mo., said he had decided not to release the name of the officer who shot Michael Brown because of threats against the officer and the department.
abstract: Chief of police in Ferguson, Mo, says he will not release name of the police officer involved in fatal shooting of unarmed African-American teenager Michael Brown, citing concerns about the officer's safety.

byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Ferguson, and Timothy Williams from New York. Erica Goode contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The police chief in Ferguson, Mo., said he had decided not to release the name of the officer who shot Michael Brown because of threats against the officer and the department.

headline.main: Missouri Police Cite Threats in Deciding Not to Name Officer Who Shot Teenager
headline.print_headline: Police Cite Threats in Deciding Not to Name Officer Who Shot Missouri Teenager
